subclassFeature.name: Shaded Soul
entries: Your soul has been marked by the Plane of Shadow. This gloom did not shatter your mind—it strengthened your will. The darkness clings to you, answers you, and bends to your command.

entries.name: Shaded Soul Origin Spells
entries: You learn additional spells when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown on the Shaded Soul Spells table. Each spell counts as a sorcerer spell for you, but it doesn't count against the number of sorcerer spells you know.

entries.caption: Shaded Soul Spells
rows: {@spell Dissonant Whispers}, {@spell Mind Sliver}, {@spell Pass without Trace}, {@spell Nondetection}

entries.name: A Shadow Beyond Sight
entries: Starting at 3rd level, when you hit a creature with a spell attack from a sorcerer spell, or when a creature fails a saving throw against one of your sorcerer spells, you can mark that creature with shadow magic (no action required).
Until the start of your next turn, you gain the following benefits against the marked creature:

items: You are {@condition invisible} to that creature while you are more than 10 feet away from it.
The next attack roll you make against that creature before the end of your next turn has {@variantrule advantage}.

entries: You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Eyes of the Dark
entries: At 3rd level, you gain darkvision with a range of 120 feet. You can see normally in magical darkness that you create.
Additionally, you learn the {@spell darkness} spell. It counts as a sorcerer spell for you and doesn't count against the number of spells you know.

subclassFeature.name: Cloak of Enveloping Shade
entries: At 6th level, your connection to the shadow grants you resistance to psychic damage.
As a bonus action, you can spend 2 sorcery points to wreath yourself in a cloak of dancing shadows for 1 minute. While the cloak is active, you gain the following benefits:

items: Your walking speed increases by 10 feet, and your jump distance increases by 10 feet.
You gain a +2 bonus to your Armor Class.

entries.name: Shadow Walk
entries: Also at 6th level, while you are in dim light or darkness, you can use a bonus action to teleport up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space you can see that is also in dim light or darkness.

subclassFeature.name: Eclipse Dome
entries: Starting at 14th level, you can manifest a 30-foot radius dome of magical darkness centered on yourself. The dome lasts for 1 minute.

When you create the dome, you gain temporary hit points equal to your sorcerer level. While you are inside the dome, you know the location of all creatures within it, though you do not learn their conditions.

When you create the dome, you choose any number of creatures you can see. Those creatures can see normally within the dome. All other creatures treat the area as heavily obscured unless they possess {@sense blindsight} or {@sense truesight}. Creatures that rely on {@sense darkvision} cannot see through this darkness.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest, unless you spend 6 sorcery points to use it again.

subclassFeature.name: Umbral Wave
entries: At 18th level, you gain immunity to psychic damage. Additionally, while in dim light or darkness, you can take the Hide action even if you are only lightly obscured.

As an action, you can spend 5 sorcery points to unleash a wave of shadow in a 30-foot cone. Creatures of your choice in the area must make an Intelligence saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, a creature is {@condition blinded} until the end of your next turn. Until that blindness ends, once per turn when you move at least 10 feet, you can teleport to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of one creature blinded by this feature.
On a successful save, the creature is not blinded but has {@variantrule disadvantage} on the next attack roll it makes before the end of its next turn.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest, unless you spend 6 sorcery points to use it again.

item.name: Miner's Tools
entries: Miner's Tools include a heavy pick, a shovel, a hammer, chisels, and a stiff brush used to excavate earth and identify ore.

items.name: Utilize
items.entry: Chip off a stone sample ({@dc 10}), Determine tunnel stability ({@dc 15}), Extract a gem or crystal intact ({@dc 15}), Create a small defensive earthwork ({@dc 15}).

entries: If you have proficiency with a tool, add your {@table Proficiency Bonus|XPHB} to any ability check you make that uses the tool. If you have proficiency in a skill that's used with that check, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the check too.

You have toiled in the sunless depths where the veil between the Material Plane and the Shadowfell is dangerously thin. Your hands are callous and stained with coal and dark crystal dust, and your lungs have grown accustomed to air that tastes of stale magic. While others fear the dark, you have learned to navigate it.

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: Choose A or B: (A) {@item Miner's Pick|PHB}, {@item Shovel|XPHB}, {@item Dungeoneer's Pack|XPHB}, {@item Traveler's Clothes|XPHB}, 10 GP; or (B) 50 GP

entries: The machinery of the kingdom runs on ink, stamps, and the occasional silenced witness. You were once a cog in this corrupt engine, falsifying reports to cover up the horrors of the mines. Whether you fled due to guilt or became a liability, you carry the secrets of the state.

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: Choose A or B: (A) {@item Calligrapher's Supplies|XPHB}, {@item Fine Clothes|XPHB}, {@item Ink|XPHB}, {@item Ink Pen|XPHB}, {@item Paper|XPHB}, {@item Map or Scroll Case|XPHB}, 20 GP; or (B) 50 GP

entries: You wore the badge of the crown, sworn to uphold order in a kingdom sliding into chaos. Now, disillusioned by the corruption you served, you walk a fine line between the lawman you were trained to be and the vigilante the world needs.

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: Choose A or B: (A) {@item Manacles|XPHB}, {@item Healer's Kit|XPHB}, {@item Signal Whistle|XPHB}, {@item Traveler's Clothes|XPHB}, {@item Bullseye Lantern|XPHB}, {@item Oil|XPHB}, 10 GP; or (B) 50 GP

entries: Where others see terrifying monsters and creeping gloom, you see a fascinating ecosystem waiting to be cataloged. You have dedicated your life to studying the bleed of the Shadowfell, risking your sanity to understand the metaphysics of darkness.

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: Choose A or B: (A) {@item Alchemist's Supplies|XPHB}, {@item Scholar's Pack|XPHB}, {@item Robe|XPHB}, 15 GP; or (B) 50 GP

entries: Born in the gutters under the shadow of tyrannical spires, you are the voice of the voiceless. Whether organizing strikes, spreading propaganda, or sabotaging supply lines, you fight for a dawn that seems impossible to reach.

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: Choose A or B: (A) {@item Thieves' Tools|XPHB}, {@item Crowbar|XPHB}, {@item Burglar's Pack|XPHB}, {@item Traveler's Clothes|XPHB}, 5 GP; or (B) 50 GP

entries: In a crumbling kingdom, morality is a luxury you cannot afford. You operate in the gray markets, dealing in illicit goods. You understand the value of everything and know exactly whose palms to grease to get what you want.

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: Choose A or B: (A) {@item Disguise Kit|XPHB}, {@item Dice Set|XPHB}, {@item Fine Clothes|XPHB}, {@item Dagger|XPHB}, 15 GP; or (B) 50 GP

entries: Your name was once spoken with reverence, but now it is whispered as a cautionary tale. Cast out for political failure, you retain your education and bearing. You carry the weight of a fallen house, seeking to reclaim your honor.

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: Choose A or B: (A) {@item Dragonchess Set|XPHB}, {@item Fine Clothes|XPHB}, {@item Signet Ring|PHB}, {@item Perfume|XPHB}, {@item Steel Mirror|PHB}, 25 GP; or (B) 50 GP

entries: Identity is fluid, and truth is a commodity. You are a master of blending in. You have sold secrets to both the crown and the resistance, surviving by making yourself indispensable—and invisible.

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: Choose A or B: (A) {@item Forgery Kit|XPHB}, {@item Hooded Lantern|XPHB}, {@item Oil|XPHB}, {@item Traveler's Clothes|XPHB}, {@item Chalk (1 piece)|PHB}, 15 GP; or (B) 50 GP

entries: You swore oaths to protect the weak, but the Shadowfell's encroachment shattered those ideals. Having forsaken your title, you are now a warrior without a master, a blade seeking a new purpose in a dying world.

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: Choose A or B: (A) {@item Smith's Tools|XPHB}, {@item Whetstone|PHB}, {@item Traveler's Clothes|XPHB}, {@item Explorer's Pack|XPHB}, {@item Holy Symbol|XPHB}, 10 GP; or (B) 50 GP

entries: The Shadowfell did not just touch your life; it seeped into your blood. Raised in the proximity of dark rifts, you possess an innate connection to the gloom. Normal society shuns you, but you find comfort in the dark places.

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: Choose A or B: (A) {@item Herbalism Kit|XPHB}, {@item Quarterstaff|XPHB}, {@item Common Clothes|PHB}, {@item Blanket|XPHB}, {@item Tinderbox|XPHB}, 10 GP; or (B) 50 GP

feat.name: Deep Delver
entries: You have adapted to the crushing dark of the mines. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You gain {@sense darkvision} out to a range of 60 feet. If you already have darkvision, its range increases by 30 feet.

entries.name: Subterranean Survival
entries: You have {@variantrule advantage|XPHB} on {@skill Wisdom} ({@skill Survival}) checks made while underground or in the Shadowfell.

entries.name: Tremorsense
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can gain {@sense tremorsense} with a range of 10 feet until the start of your next turn.

feat.name: Forger's Insight
entries: Your experience with bureaucracy allows you to manipulate official records. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Tool Proficiency
entries: You gain proficiency with the {@item forgery kit|XPHB}.

entries.name: Mimicry
entries: If you spend at least 1 minute observing a creature's handwriting, you can mimic it perfectly.

entries.name: Bureaucratic Deception
entries: When you make a {@skill Deception} check involving written documents or bureaucratic procedures, you can use your {@skill Intelligence} modifier instead of your {@skill Charisma} modifier.

feat.name: Badge of Authority
entries: You still carry the aura of the law, however tarnished. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Commanding Voice
entries: You learn the {@spell Command} spell. You can cast it once without expending a spell slot, and you regain the ability to do so when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Intimidating Presence
entries: You have {@variantrule advantage|XPHB} on {@skill Intimidation} checks directed at commoners or low-ranking soldiers affiliated with the kingdom.

feat.name: Shadow Scholar
entries: Your research into forbidden lore grants you minor magical abilities. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Cantrip
entries: You learn one cantrip of your choice from the {@filter Wizard spell list|spells|class=Wizard|level=0|school=N;I}. {@skill Intelligence} is your spellcasting ability for it.

entries.name: Detect Shadow
entries: You can cast {@spell Detect Magic} once without expending a spell slot. When cast this way, the spell specifically highlights auras originating from the Shadowfell with a deep purple hue. You regain the ability to cast it in this way when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

feat.name: Urban Guerrilla
entries: You are adept at fighting and moving within the city's underbelly. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Street Movement
entries: Moving through nonmagical difficult terrain costs you no extra movement if you are in an urban environment (such as sewers, alleys, or ruins).

entries.name: Defiant Spirit
entries: When you fail a saving throw against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}, you can use your reaction to reroll the save. You must use the new roll. You can use this feature once per {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

feat.name: Black Market Contacts
entries: You know how to navigate the criminal underworld. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Thieves' Cant
entries: You learn {@language Thieves' Cant}.

entries.name: Underworld Dealings
entries: While in a city or settlement, you can find fences willing to buy stolen non-magical goods at full value, or merchants willing to sell poisons and potions at a 20 percent discount.

feat.name: Noble Presence
entries: Your upbringing demands respect, inspiring those around you. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Inspiring Magic
entries: You learn the {@spell Heroism} spell. You can cast it once without expending a spell slot, and you regain the ability to do so when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Social Influence
entries: You have a pool of 3 social points. When you make a {@skill Persuasion} check, you can spend 1 social point to gain {@variantrule advantage|XPHB} on the roll. You regain all expended points when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

feat.name: Face Dancer
entries: You are a master of disguise and infiltration. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Master of Disguise
entries: You can cast {@spell Disguise Self} once without expending a spell slot. You regain the ability to do so when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Unreadable
entries: Creatures have {@variantrule disadvantage|XPHB} on {@skill Insight} checks made to determine your true identity or intentions while you are disguised.

feat.name: Oathbreaker's Strike
entries: You channel the pain of your broken vows into your strikes. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Heavy Armor Proficiency
entries: You gain proficiency with Heavy Armor.

entries.name: Necrotic Strike
entries: Once per turn, when you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can deal an extra {@damage 1d4} necrotic damage to the target.

feat.name: Child of the Gloom
entries: The shadow energy infused in your blood protects you. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Shadow Resilience
entries: You have resistance to necrotic damage.

entries.name: Gloom Thaumaturgy
entries: You learn the {@spell Thaumaturgy} cantrip. When you cast it, the sensory effects manifest as shadowy distortions (e.g., dimming lights, whispered echoes).
